Modifying an Existing Field

The application allows you to modify certain property fields and any custom fields that your team has created.

The only application property fields that can be modified are enumerated types. For example, Priority is an existing change request field that can be customized. On the Synopsis tab of the Change Request Properties dialog, Priority has the values Yes and No, but it is implemented as an enumerated type, with Yes having the numeric code 1, and No having the numeric code 0. If your company would prefer to prioritize change requests on a scale from 1 (high) to 10 (low), you can add additional values to Priority. You can use the numeric codes 0 and 1 with new names (instead of Yes and No) or disable them.

To modify an existing property field:

  1. Select one of the following:

    • File > Advanced > Customize.

    • Change Request > Advanced > Customize.

    • Topic > Advanced > Customize.

    • Task > Advanced > Customize.

    The Customize dialog lists application fields that can be customized by an icon with a pencil in the center it (fully customizable) or an icon with a small yellow lock in the bottom left corner (where only display names can be changed). If user-defined fields are enabled, it shows an icon with the head and shoulders of a person, and if they are disabled, the same icon is greyed-out. All user-defined fields are fully customizable.

  2. Select the field to be edited.

  3. Double-click the field, or click Edit to open the Modify Field dialog.

  4. Make the required changes. See below for the changes that can be made to different types of fields.

  5. Click OK.

Possible Field Changes

Enumerated Types

  • Add values to possible values (all fields but those with an icon displaying a small yellow lock in its bottom left corner).

  • Change the names of possible values.

  • Change its default value (all fields but those with an icon displaying a small yellow lock in its bottom left corner).

  • Change the display name (only fields with an icon displaying a pencil in its center or an icon displaying the head and shoulders of a person).

  • Disable possible values (all fields but those with an icon displaying a small yellow lock in its bottom left corner).

  • Enable disabled values (all fields but those with an icon displaying a small yellow lock in its bottom left corner).

  • Reorder possible values (all fields but those with an icon displaying a small yellow lock in its bottom left corner).

Integer or Real Types

  • Change the display name.

  • Enter a new default value.

Text Types

  • Change the display name.

  • Indicate whether the field is required or elective.

    •   Note: You cannot change maximum length.

Date/Time Types

  • Change the display name.

  • Enter a new default value.

User ID Types

  • Change the display name.

  • Indicate whether the field is required or elective.
